question:
In line with the government’s plan to make Indian Railways accident free, a number of projects are being undertaken- such as the pilot project involving LIDAR. Consider the following statements:
  1. Central railway zone is looking to implement a pilot project involving LIDAR to detect cracks and faults on the track.
  2. Automated Train Examination System is a technology developed as a part of ‘Make in India’ initiative.
  3. Rashtriya Rail Sanraksha Kosh was setup on recommendation of Kakodhar commission.
Which of the above statements are correct? Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Explanation: Statement 1 is correct: LIDAR is Light detection and ranging technology. The Central railway zone is looking to implement this in its network after the technology’s use in the Konkan railways. It will create 3D maps to detect faults and cracks in the tracks in matter of minutes, enabling immediate response. It will minimise human intervention and reduce staff causalities. Statement 2 is correct: Automated Train Examination System/ ATES was introduced in the Central railway zone. It eliminates the need for manual monitoring. It was developed by Konkan Railway Corporation limited. It was developed as part of Make in India initiative, to check for cases of hot axle, brake binding etc., on all trains passing through the track on which it’s installed. Statement 3 is correct: Rashtriya Rail Sanraksha Kosh was a fund set up in 2017-18 for critical safety works in the railways. It was on the recommendation of Dr. Anil Kakodhar - a former chairman of Atomic Energy Commission. It is a non-lapsable fund of 20,000 crore INR.
